tit.j: ウェスティン都ホテル京都

sen.j: ウェスティン都ホテル京都 (The Westin Miyako Kyoto) は、京都市東山区三条通にある最高級ホテル。
sen.e: The Westin Miyako, Kyoto is a highest-class hotel located along Sanjo-dori Street in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
The Westin Miyako, Kyoto is the highest-class hotel located along Sanjo-dori Street in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
The Westin Miyako, Kyoto is the highest-class hotel located along Sanjo-dori Street in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: スターウッド・ホテル&リゾートの1つである。
sen.e: The hotel belogs to Starwood Hotels & Resorts.
The hotel belongs to Starwood Hotels & Resorts.
The hotel belongs to Starwood Hotels & Resorts.

sen.j: 運営は都ホテルズ&リゾーツ。
sen.e: It is operated by Miyako hotels & Resorts.
It is operated by Miyako hotels & Resorts.
It is operated by Miyako hotels & Resorts.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1890年4月、油商の西村仁兵衛が華頂山麓に保養遊園地「吉水園」を創業。
sen.e: In April, 1890, Jinbei Nishinura (西村仁兵衛), an oil marchant, opened Yoshimizuen, a recreational ammusement park, at the foot of Kacho-zan Mountain.
In April, 1890, Jinbei Nishinura (西村仁兵衛), an oil marchant, opened Yoshimizuen, a recreational ammusement park, at the foot of Kacho-zan Mountain.
In April, 1890, Jinbe NISHIMURA, an oil merchant, opened 'Yoshimizuen,' a recreational amusement park, at the foot of Kacho-zan Mountain.
sen.cmt: merchant、amusementスペル訂正しました。西村仁兵衛→Jinbe NISHIMURAとしました。原文の「」に合わせて' '補足しました。

sen.j: 1900年に園内にて「都ホテル」を創業。
sen.e: He opened Miyako Hotel within the park in 1900.
He opened Miyako Hotel within the park in 1900.
He opened Miyako Hotel within the park in 1900.

sen.j: 以来、日本最大の観光地である京都の迎賓館として最高級ホテルとして君臨し続けてきた。
sen.e: Since then, the hotel has kept the position of a highest-class hotel, as the guest house of Kyoto, the largest sightseeing place in Japan.
Since then, the hotel has kept the position of the highest-class hotel, as the guest house of Kyoto, the largest sightseeing place in Japan.
Since then, the hotel has kept the position of the highest-class hotel, as the guest house of Kyoto, the largest sightseeing place in Japan.

sen.j: 1960年には村野藤吾の設計による現在の本館が完成。
sen.e: In 1960, the present main hall designed by Togo MURANO was completed.
In 1960, the present main hall designed by Togo MURANO was completed.
In 1960, the present main hall designed by Togo MURANO was completed.

sen.j: 2002年4月に、都ホテルがスターウッド・ホテル&リゾートと提携し、ウェスティンブランドに仲間入りし、現在の名称に変更。
sen.e: In April of 2002, Miyako Hotel started business partnership with Starwood Hotels & Resorts, particitating in the Westin brand, and the hotel name was changed into the present one.
In April of 2002, Miyako Hotel started a business partnership with Starwood Hotels & Resorts, participating in the Westin brand, and the hotel name was changed to the present one.
In April of 2002, Miyako Hotel started a business partnership with Starwood Hotels & Resorts, participating in the Westin brand, and the hotel name was changed to the present one.

sen.j: これに伴い、大規模なリノベーションを行い新装オープン。
sen.e: Corresponding to the start of the partnership, the hotel was drastically renovated, and opened newly.
Corresponding to the start of the partnership, the hotel was drastically renovated, and newly opened.
Corresponding to the start of the partnership, the hotel was drastically renovated, and newly opened.

sen.j: スターウッドが持つ世界規模の会員組織と予約システムにより、それまで少なかった外国人宿泊客が4人に1人に急増するなど、客室平均稼働率は提携前の60％から80％に上昇している。
sen.e: With the Starwood's world-wide member organization and reservation systm, foreign guests staying the hotel, whose number was small before, increased rapidly to 1/4 of all guests staying overnight, and the average room-occupying rate was also increased from 60% (before the start of the business partnership) to 80%.

With the Starwood's world-wide member organization and reservation systm, foreign guests staying at the hotel, whose number was small before, increased rapidly to 1/4 of all guests staying overnight, and the average room-occupying rate was also increased from 60% (before the start of the business partnership) to 80%.

With the Starwood's world-wide member organization and reservation system, foreign guests staying at the hotel, whose number was small before, increased rapidly to 1/4 of all guests staying overnight, and the average room-occupying rate was also increased from 60% (before the start of the business partnership) to 80%.

sen.j: 京都新聞2005年12月6日掲載
sen.e: It appeared on The Kyoto Shimbun Newspaper on December 6, 2005.
It appeared on The Kyoto Shimbun Newspaper on December 6, 2005.
It appeared on the Kyoto Shimbun Newspaper on December 6, 2005.

sen.j: 設備
sen.e: Facilities
Facilities
Facilities

sen.j: 宴会場「葵殿」の南に広がる葵殿庭園は日本近代庭園の先覚者として有名な小川治兵衛によって1933年に作庭された回遊式庭園である。
sen.e: The Aoiden garden spreading in the south of the Aoiden banquet hall is a walking-through type one designed in 1933 by Jihee OGAWA, famous as a pioneer of modern Japanese gardens.
The Aoiden garden spreading in the south of the Aoiden banquet hall is a walk-through type, one designed in 1933 by Jihee OGAWA, famous as a pioneer of modern Japanese gardens.
The Aoi-den garden spreading in the south of the Aoi-den banquet hall is a walk-through type, one designed in 1933 by Jihe OGAWA, famous as a pioneer of modern Japanese gardens.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。小川治兵衛→Jihe OGAWAとしました。

sen.j: また、佳水園庭園は7代目小川治兵衛の長男白楊により、大正14年（1925年）に作庭され、醍醐寺三宝院（京都市伏見区）の庭を模して造られている。
sen.e: The Kasuien garden was built in 1925 by Hakuyo, the eldest son of the the seventh Jihee OGAWA, imitating the garden of Sanboin of Daigo-ji Temple in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
The Kasuien garden was built in 1925 by Hakuyo, the eldest son of the the seventh Jihee OGAWA, imitating the garden of Sanboin of Daigo-ji Temple in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
The Kasui-en garden was built in 1925 by Hakuyo, the eldest son of the seventh Jihe OGAWA, imitating the garden of Sanbo-in of Daigo-ji Temple in Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 余分なtheを削除しました。ハイフン補足しました。小川治兵衛→Jihe OGAWAとしました。

sen.j: 葵殿庭園と佳水園庭園はともに1994年に京都市文化財（名勝）に登録された。
sen.e: Both of the Aoiden garden and the Kasuien garden were designated as cultural properties (beauty spots) in 1994 by Kyoto City.
Both the Aoiden garden and the Kasuien garden were designated cultural properties (beauty spots) in 1994 by Kyoto City.
Both the Aoi-den garden and the Kasui-en garden were designated cultural properties (beauty spots) in 1994 by Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。

sen.j: 佳水園庭園内の和風別館「佳水園」は村野藤吾の設計により1959年に完成し、戦後の数寄屋造り建築の傑作としても知られる。
sen.e: Kasuien, a Japanese style annex designed by Togo MURANO and completed within the Kasuien garden in 1959, is known as a masterpiece of sukiya-zukuri style buildings af the war.
Kasuien, a Japanese style annex designed by Togo MURANO and completed within the Kasuien garden in 1959, is known as a masterpiece of sukiya-zukuri style buildings after the war.
Kasui-en,' a Japanese style annex designed by Togo MURANO and completed within the Kasui-en garden in 1959, is known as a masterpiece of sukiya-zukuri style buildings after the war.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。原文に合わせて' '補足しました。

sen.j: 佳水園ではホテルにいながら伝統的な日本旅館のサービスを受けることができる。
sen.e: In Kasuien, you can enjoy services of traditional Japanes inns while being in a hotel.
In Kasuien, you can enjoy services of traditional Japanese inns while staying in the hotel.
In Kasui-en, you can enjoy services of traditional Japanese inns while staying in the hotel.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。

Railways

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄東西線蹴上駅すぐ
sen.e: Use of the Tozai Line of Kyoto City Subway: Get off at Keage Station and you will find it immediately.
Take the Tozai Line Kyoto City Subway: Get off at Keage Station and you will find it immediately.
Take the Tozai Line Kyoto City Subway: Get off at Keage Station and you will find it immediately.

sen.j: 関西国際空港からJR特急はるかで75分
sen.e: From Kansai International Airport: Get on JR Limited Express Haruka, and it takes 75 minutes.
From Kansai International Airport: Get on the JR Limited Express Haruka, and it takes 75 minutes.
From Kansai International Airport: Get on the JR Limited Express Haruka, and it takes 75 minutes.

sen.j: バス
sen.e: Buses
Bus
Bus

sen.j: JR京都駅八条口からホテルバスで約20分
sen.e: From Kyoto Station: A bus of the hotel is available at the Hachjo entrance/exit place, and it takes about 20 mintes.
From Kyoto Station: A bus from the hotel is available at the Hachjo entrance/exit place, and it takes about 20 minutes.
From Kyoto Station: A bus from the hotel is available at the Hachjo entrance/exit place, and it takes about 20 minutes.

sen.j: 大阪国際空港からリムジンバスが運行されている。
sen.e: From Osaka Internetional Airport: Limousine buses are avilable.
From Osaka Internetional Airport: Limousine buses are avilable.
From Osaka International Airport: Limousine buses are available.
